meta.description: Cathay Pacific The Wing Business Class Lounge at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Cathay Pacific The Wing Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Levels 6 and 7, reception near Gates 1-4 on Level 6

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description: The Wing is Cathay Pacific’s flagship lounge at the Hong Kong International Airport. It set a new standard in airline ground service when it launched in 1998, offering passengers unparalleled levels of comfort and convenience. Inside this exclusive space, passengers have the freedom to recharge, relax, or catch up on some work.

reviews.content: Beautiful lounge with a wide selection of western and Asian food. There were a few patches of worn carpet, but otherwise very well appointed.
Tired, unkempt, and overcrowded. Food of dubious quality. My first Cathay experience and I’m wondering what all the fuss is about.
Crowded on a Sunday morning. Furnishings are extremely tired and dirty in business class lounge. Not enough seating. A joke. Waiting at the gate may be better.
Large lounge and busy. If you sit in the first section you have no window view due to high bar seating. The pork buns rock my world though!! And the Moët! Can’t wait for my next Cathay flight!
Great showers, but soft furnishings a bit tied. Food not exciting but the bar is good. Overall large but busy.
Lounge is comfortable, but the shower facilities rocked my world! Staff was friendly and helpful, and they had amenities to take care of my needs and soothing music. It's an oasis in the busy chaos!
Food was good. The separate stations were also a nice touch. Don't forget to order the Möet!
Average. Dirty dishes were everywhere (over 3 hours), service at the bar was slow. Noisy environment. Convenient, but not relaxing.
Probably the best business lounge in Asia - the experience of noodle bar, excellent service and huge space define the place to wait for departure.
Since they changed the catering company, the food hasn't been as good as it used to. Although, it's still decent. Noodles are the best part!
Amazing lounge - great food and tons of seating.
Not much to criticize except it's a bit crowded even at 11 pm. Coffee bar with creme brûlée espressos, noodle bar, full alcohol bar, nice showers, etc., etc.  Maybe a few more TVs with CNN.
Really good lounge when not too busy. Plenty of seating options and good food and drink. Can get very busy at times. Grab a seat at the bar and catch the apron view. Barman friendly and attentive.
Great lounge as far as amenities. Horrible service, particularly compared to other Asia lounges. I'm talking down to the wait staff. Also, so so hard to find. No signage whatsoever.
This is an outstanding lounge with hot soups, gourmet coffees, top shelf drinks, and gracious service from the staff. Physically the wing has a commanding sense of space and never feels crammed.
The best one and the best view of the airplanes.
There are a lot of people and seating upstairs close to a power outlet was hard to come by. Downstairs seemed to have a lot of screaming (and I mean screaming) children. The furniture is comfy.
When you provide great ice cream, that really impresses me. But besides that, the lounge is so spacious and offers delicious food and drinks.
Awesome place. Was able to find seats even during the Monday morning rush. The lounge wifi was faster and more stable then the airport free wifi. Made to order noodles were good and fast.
One of my favorite lounges. Love the noodle bar. Spacious spanning two levels. Very bright. Can get very busy though.
I really like how this lounge has a few different areas depending on what kind of atmosphere you want: low-light, quiet ambience downstairs; bright, "open-air" inside balcony for a more lively space.
Compared to many other lounges around the world, this is 4 to 5 stars. The first class lounge is a 5. There are every few lounges of this calibre and they are also 4/5 stars. Great lounge.
If you have a long layover, I can't think of a better lounge to be in.

Very good lounge, comfortable and clean with 24 hours hot food available. No extra charge for all food, drink, dessert and wines. Ice cream and cocktails are great. Best business lounge in HKG airport.

I thought this lounge would be bigger & have some more seating. However, the noodles are excellent and showers are good. It's open in most places so you do get background noise but overall great stop.
Good selection of food and drink, attentive staff at front desk to assist with reservations, nice showers. Long Bar is a great spot to relax, and the Solus chairs are good to get work done.
Love this lounge. Food, decor and service. Just brilliant!
Good variety of food and drinks on offer and not too crowded.
Great spacious lounge full of amenities. Try the Pier for an even more outstanding experience.
Light, airy, hospitable staff and great food. Pretty sleek looks too.
Very nice lounge with all the amenities. It is very large, but very popular and can get busy so it doesn't have the same feel or service as smaller venues. Still, a great spot to pass a long layover.
One of the best lounges in the world. Lots of distinct areas, noodle bar, coffee bar, beautiful views, great furniture, spa-like showers.
I love this lounge so much. I always look forward to stopping by whenever I'm in Hong Kong.
great relaxing space, wide selection of food and a nice view over the airport, but at peak times can become busy and packed
Though this lounge is a bit far from everything, it is quite spacious and comfortable.
It can get crowded at times, but has all the amenities you would want from a business class lounge.
If you're entitled to access it, I definitely recommend a visit! There's nothing about the lounge that I can fault.
As with any of the Cathay Lounges in HKG, you can't go wrong with this lounge.
This is a great lounge! If you have the chance to visit, definitely do not miss it.
